title: THE WIDOW
author: John Grisham
description: When Simon Latch, a lawyer in rural Virginia, is accused of murder, he goes in search of the real killer.

title: THE HOUSEMAID
author: Freida McFadden
description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

title: THE CORRESPONDENT
author: Virginia Evans
description: Letters from someone she used to know push Sybil Van Antwerp toward revisiting her past and finding a way to forgive.

title: THE SECRET OF SECRETS
author: Dan Brown
description: As he searches for the missing noetic scientist he has been seeing, Robert Langdon discovers something regarding a secret project.

title: THEO OF GOLDEN
author: Allen Levi
description: A man travels to a small Southern town, where he purchases pencil drawings of local residents and exchanges them for stories.

title: THE LOOK
author: Michelle Obama with Meredith Koop
description: A celebration of the former first lady’s evolution in style, featuring more than 200 photographs.

author: Andrew Ross Sorkin
description: The New York Times journalist and CNBC host looks at the fight between Washington and Wall Street that fueled a historic crash of the stock market.

title: HOW TO TEST NEGATIVE FOR STUPID
author: John Kennedy
description: The Republican senator from Louisiana shares stories about politics in Washington, D.C., and in his home state.

title: THE GALES OF NOVEMBER
author: John U. Bacon
description: An account of the sinking of the Edmund Fitzgerald, an American Great Lakes freighter, 50 years ago.

title: 107 DAYS
author: Kamala Harris
description: The former vice president recounts her abbreviated campaign to become president in 2024.

title: STOP, IN THE NAME OF GOD
author: Charlie Kirk

title: ALWAYS REMEMBER: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX, THE HORSE AND THE STORM
author: Charlie Mackesy

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: THE COMPLETE BAKING BOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: One hundred plus kid-tested baking recipes. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: GROWING HOME
author: Beth Ferry. Illustrated Terry Fan and Eric Fan
description: Talking plants, a grumpy goldfish and an inquisitive spider save the Tupper family from utter ruin. (Ages 6 to 9)

title: THE COURT OF THE DEAD
author: Rick Riordan and Mark Oshiro
description: Nico, Will and Hazel delve into the mysterious disappearances of monsters at Camp Jupiter. (Ages 10 to 14)

title: THE POISONED KING
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: Christopher and Anya must save the dragons of the Archipelago from a strange new threat. (Ages 10 and up)

title: CHRISTMAS AT HOGWARTS
author: J.K. Rowling. Illustrated Ziyi Gao
description: Harry Potter celebrates his first Christmas at Hogwarts. (Ages 6 and up)

title: LITTLE RED SLEIGH
author: Erin Guendelsberger. Illustrated Elizaveta Tretyakova
description: Little Red Sleigh dreams of becoming Santa's sleigh one day. (Ages 4 and up)

title: HOW TO CATCH SANTA CLAUS
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: The How to Catch Kids attempt to snare Santa Claus. (Ages 4 to 10)

title: SEE YOU LATER, ALLIGATOR!
author: Sally Hopgood. Illustrated Emma Levey
description: A departing tortoise says goodbye to all his animal friends. (Ages 3 to 6)

title: BLUEY'S NIGHT BEFORE CHRISTMAS
author: Lauren Holowaty. Illustrated Kiara Hankinson, Jemma Bayley and Costa Kassab
description: Bluey's take on "A Visit From St. Nicholas." (Ages 3 to 5)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: LIGHTLARK SAGA
author: Alex Aster
description: Every 100 years the island of Lightlark appears and a deadly competition called the Centennial takes place. (Ages 13 and up)

title: THE WAY THINGS WORK: NEWLY REVISED EDITION
author: David Macaulay
description: A look at how technology impacts our lives. (Ages 11 to 15)

title: FAKE SKATING
author: Lynn Painter
description: After years of separation, the childhood friends Alec and Dani reunite and face their true feelings toward each other. (Ages 14 and up)

title: IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
author: Laura Nowlin
description: In this companion to “If He Had Been With Me,” the story of Finn and Autumn is told through three different perspectives. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: HOUR OF THE PUMPKIN QUEEN
author: Megan Shepherd
description: After a potion demonstration goes awry, Sally and Luna fall through a portal to Time Town. (Ages 12 and up)

title: BETTER IN BLACK
author: Cassandra Clare
description: Ten love stories featuring characters from the Shadowhunter Chronicles. (Ages 14 and up)
